page.title: 05CHURCHES
page.content: The churches in the villages are complementary to each other.CHARLTON ADAM church is a small but beautiful building,big enough for the ordinary weekly services.It is enhanced by paintings given to the church by the late Mrs.Claude Neville. CHARLTON MACKRELL church is a larger building,needed for the more important occasions.The building was drastically altered in Victorian times,gaining wooden angels and losing its original pulpit.In recent years much has been done to improve the church,most recently the reflooring of the Lyte's Chapel.Due to the droughts of 1979 and 1984,and to the presence of several large lime trees in the churchyard,one wall is subsiding.A rescue effort is under way,involving the raising of at least Â£35,000.
